title: Fix Training Document #3 PDF link so it opens the reuploaded file

requirements.text: Update Training Document #3 (title: "Transforming Adversity into Lasting Professional and Personal Maturity.") so the line-2 link text "The attached PDF file (11,939 KB)" opens the correct PDF instead of looping back to the website.

quotes: Next, for training document #3, "Transforming Adversity into Lasting Professional and Personal Maturity". When selecting the access button 'The attached PDF file (11,939 KB)', it does not lead to the document. Rather, it does a loop right back to the website. I am reuploading the pdf file for that line-2. So when selecting, the document opens-up!

acceptanceCriteria: In the Training Documents section, clicking the line-2 link for document #3 opens the PDF in a new tab (browser loads a PDF document, not the SPA home page).
The PDF URL resolves successfully (no redirect to index.html / no 404).
The displayed link text remains exactly: "The attached PDF file (11,939 KB)".

requirements.text: Add the reuploaded PDF file for Training Document #3 as a static frontend asset under the app’s /assets/ path, and ensure the backend’s Training Document #3 `documentUrl` exactly matches the stored filename (including spaces/case) so `getStaticAssetUrl(documentUrl)` resolves correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: The reuploaded PDF exists in the frontend build output under `/assets/` and can be fetched directly via browser.
`backend/main.mo` returns `documentUrl` for training document id=3 that matches the uploaded PDF filename exactly.
The generated href in `frontend/src/components/TrainingVideos.tsx` points to a working `/assets/<encoded-filename>.pdf` URL for document #3.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Do not modify files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or other immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.

Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in `backend/main.mo`; only add `backend/migration.mo` if state migration is required (this change should not require migration if only updating hardcoded document metadata and static assets).
nonGoals: Do not change the titles, ordering, or formatting of other training documents or training videos.
Do not change access control/membership gating behavior for training content.
Do not redesign the Training Documents UI beyond what is necessary to fix the broken link.
